snippet: A harassment complaint against Paula Broadwell led F.B.I. agents to e-mails between her and David H. Petraeus, who resigned Friday as the director of the C.I.A., that revealed their affair, an official said.
abstract: Government officials say FBI investigation that led to sudden resignation of David H Petraeus as CIA director began with complaint about harassing e-mails sent by Petraeus biographer Paula Broadwell to another woman; FBI agents discovered exchanges between Petraeus and Broadwell that indicated they were having affair after following up on complaint.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear, Charlie Savage and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A harassment complaint against Paula Broadwell led F.B.I. agents to e-mails between her and David H. Petraeus, who resigned Friday as the director of the C.I.A., that revealed their affair, an official said.

headline.seo: F.B.I. Said to Have Stumbled Into News of Petraeus Affair
headline.main: Biographer’s E-Mails to Woman Led F.B.I. to Petraeus
headline.print_headline: Author’s E-Mails to a Third Party Led to Petraeus

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
